org.apache.oodt.commons

Class ExecServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.oodt.commons.ExecServer

  • public class ExecServer
extends Object
    Server execution program. This is an executable class that starts a JPL EDA server.
    Author:
    Kelly

    • Constructor Detail

      • ExecServer

        protected ExecServer(String name)

      • ExecServer

        public ExecServer(String name,
                  String className)
           throws ClassNotFoundException,
                  NoSuchMethodException,
                  InstantiationException,
                  IllegalAccessException,
                  InvocationTargetException,
                  DOMException,
                  UnknownHostException
        Create a new executable server.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the server
        className - Name of class that implements the server.
        Throws:
        ClassNotFoundException - If the class for className can't be found.
        NoSuchMethodException - If the constructor for className taking a single ExecServer can't be found.
        InstantiationException - If the class for className is abstract or is an interface.
        IllegalAccessException - If the class for className isn't public.
        InvocationTargetException - If an exception occurs in the constructor for className.
        DOMException - If the server's status document can't be created.
        UnknownHostException - If the local host name can't be determined.

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(String[] argv)
        Start a server. The command-line should have two arguments:
        1. The fully-qualified class name of the server to execute.
        2. The object name of the server to register with the naming service.
        Parameters:
        argv - The command-line arguments

      • getName

        public String getName()
        Get my name.
        Returns:
        The name under which I'm registered in teh naming context.

        public int setSystemProperty(String key,

        Set a system property. This uses the property manager to notify property change listeners.
        Parameters:

      • callLocalServerManager

        public Object callLocalServerManager(int port,
                                     String user,
                                     String password,
                                     String method,
                                     List params)
                              throws IOException,
                                     org.apache.xmlrpc.XmlRpcException
        Call the server manager on the local system.
        Parameters:
        port - What port on the local system the server manager is listening.
        user - User name to use for authentication.
        password - Authenticator for user.
        method - What method in the server manager to call.
        params - Parameters to pass to the method named by method.
        Returns:
        The return value from the method named by method.
        Throws:
        Exception - If any error occurs.
        IOException
        org.apache.xmlrpc.XmlRpcException

      • shutdown

        public int shutdown()
        Shut down and exit.
        Returns:
        Zero.

      • runInitializers

        public static void runInitializers()
                            throws EDAException
        Run all initializers. This instantiates and calls the Initializer.initialize() method of each initializer specified by class name in a comma separated list of classes in the system properties. The property name is org.apache.oodt.commons.initializers, or if not defined, org.apache.oodt.commons.ExecServer.initializers, or if not defined, initializers. And if that one's not defined, then none are run.
        Throws:
        EDAException - if an error occurs.
